comment.author: 32945250@N08
comment._content: Thompson bay, Government House in the distance far left hand side - used as a summer residence

comment.author: 15410137@N05
comment._content: This looks like Thomsons Bay (minus the "p"), named after my ancestor Robert Thomson who lived near and mined the salt lakes prior to the island being made into a prison for aboriginals who committed offences on the mainland. Robert arrived in the Swan River Colony in late 1829, the year that Perth was founded.
